required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Roxadustat in the Treatment of Acute Myocardial Infarction
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Roxadustat in Patients With Acute ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction

brief_summary.textblock:
Depite successful primary percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and standardized medical treatment, prognosis of acute ST-elevation myocardial infarction patents are still a poor, with high morality and various complications such as heart failure. Roxadustat is a new drug targeting hypoxia-inducible factor prolyl hydroxylase (HIF-PH) inhibition and has shown promising effect in reducing infarct size in pre-clinical studies.
This study aims to evaluate the efficacy and safety of early and short-term administration of roxadustat in the treatment of acute ST-elevation myocardial infarction.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is an open-label, paralleled, randomized controlled trial. It aims to evaluate the efficacy and safety of early and short-term administration of roxadustat in the treatment of acute ST-elevation myocardial infarction.

primary_outcome.description: Infarct size as a percentage of LV mass measured on delayed-enhanced CMR imaging 30 days post-MI compared to control

secondary_outcome.description: Major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) within 1 year follow-up.
Left ventricular end diastolic volume (LVEDV), Left ventricular end systolic volume (LVESV), Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) changes during 1 year follow-up
Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of CK-MB, TnI and CK
Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of CK-MB, TnI and CK

other_outcome.description: Fibroblast activation protein inhibitor (FAPI) tracer uptake in myocardium if selected patient underwent spontaneous PET/MR scan

arm_group.description: Patients only receive conventional therapies as recommended by guidelines.

intervention.description: Orally 100mg, 3 times per week for 2 weeks First dose administered immediately after successful PCI.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acute STEMI (ST segment elevation myocardial infarction) diagnosed by ST elevation
- Coronary angiography within 12 hours of symptom onset, with TIMI flow grade 0 - 1 of culprit vessel
- Primary PCI with TIMI flow grade 2 - 3 after successful intervention
- Capable and willing to provide informed consent and capable of completing study visits
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous acute myocardial infarction history
- Cardiogenic Shock at admission
- Previously treated by roxadustat
- Contraindications of roxadustat treatment
- Contraindication of Cardiac MRI (e.g. eGFR < 30 ml/min, pacemaker, metal prosthesis, etc.)

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Cardiology Department, Chief Physician

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified researchers can request access to anonymized individual patient-level data by contacting principle investigator of this study. Requests for IPD will be recieved, but this does not mean all requests will be shared by the investigators.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: 1 year after the end of this study
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Please contact the investigators through email in the time frame.
